column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I'm sorry if you feel the prices are a little pricey compared to other mom and pop ramen joints.  Jinya is a franchised business and thus more overhead that we
column6: etc. all add up while we still try to remain profitable so we can stay in business.  I do agree that Jinya isn't your typical ramen shop being that the design was created to fit the Midtown scene.  That's being said
column7: future location development in Houston may have a more "toned down" theme.  We appreciate your feedback and your patronage and hope that you will return again to Jinya and try our other selections.
